title: Dying Light's 'The Following' expansion gets a launch window - Gaming
text: You won't have to wait too long to get your hands on Dying Light's massive expansion.Titled 'The Following', the first-person survival horror game's upcoming add-on is on track to launch in the first quarter of 2016.The release date window reveal was accompanied by a video message (above) to fans from producer Tymon Smektala."Today we finally know that Dying Light: The Following will launch within the first three months of 2016," Smektala said in a statement."This gives us enough time to put in all the content and surprises we have planned for you guys. So keep your eyes peeled for some sneak peeks into what we have in the works for you all. And we promise to share the exact day of release as soon as we get a final decision." Â© Warner Bros. 'The Following' will reportedly take roughly 10 hours to complete, although this amount could extend to 20 hours if players seek out all of its secrets.It will be free to download to season pass holders, while everybody else can expect to pay $14.99 (UK pricing is yet to be announced).Dying Light launched on PlayStation 4, Xbox One and PC in January. The game takes place in an open-world environment and features a free-running gameplay mechanic.Dying Light review (Xbox One): Dead Island improved, but not perfectedCheck out our most anticipated games of October, one of many videos in Digital Spy's dedicated Gaming YouTube channel.
